ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

Yo quiero mucho a Overwatch, en serio, llevo fÃ¡cil mÃ¡s de 2000 horas en total desde el primero.

Pero me duele mucho como Blizzard trata a su propio juego No es posible que dejaran en hiatus durante 3 aÃ±os el primer juego con la excusa de que estaban haciendo el segundo, que debÃ­a incluÃ­r una campaÃ±a PvE completa segÃºn lo que prometieron, para que al final la "secuela" termine siento una beta llena de bugs, pases de batalla, skins carÃ­simas, y ni siquiera incluyera campaÃ±a PvE en el lanzamiento, y un aÃ±o despuÃ©s todavÃ­a tengan el descaro de venderte partes de la campaÃ±a PvE como DLCs a precio completo.

so far a fun game and kind of addicting. Looking forward to getting better.
There was a time when OW used to be a good game. Today is just another Blizzard cashgrab

I had purchased this game back in 2017-2018 as Overwatch 1. Back then, it was quite fun and balanced. Only thing you could buy with money, were lootboxes, which was also fine, because you got 4 random things for 1 box, but you'd also get those same lootboxes, from levelling up after matches.
Now? Overwatch 2 is a disgraceful shit-smear of what it once was. A greedy ingame shop, that costs $20 for 1 skin, a Battle pass that doesn't have any returns (example: Fortnite's battle pass giving vbucks back, to help pay for the next pass, or a skin from the shop). They claimed to add currency to the pass, when they added Lifeweaver, but nope, they don't add Overwatch coins, but Legacy credits. A currency that is only used to get overwatch 1 skins, and seeing as more content is being added, that means less and less that you can use those credits for. 
If you want a 5v5 team shooter, go play Paladins or something, leave this game to die like it should have.

Honestly, this would've been way better if it was added to steam like 7 years ago. Now it just feels weird and after what feels a few years of overwatch just being to me, extremely unfun to play after 1700 hours, I had hope the PvE was gonna change that, but now tbh there's no real reason to it what so ever, might as well just open the game, grab the achievements and uninstall.
This game use to be cool ngl, and I still love it but I just can't enjoy it anymore.
This game is gonna be moving in some positive directions for new fans (despite 3 missions being $22AUD) so I recommend it to fans of hero shooters.
If only there was another class based shooter i could play instead of this...
Matchmaking is DOGSHIT if you pick all role you will only get Tank Role FIX THIS SHIT NOW!!!!!
This game can't even suck ass correctly. Just light it on fire and let it die.

i'd like to leave a mixed review, but because I can't, I'll just pick positive purely to reflect the GAMEPLAY, art design, and sound design. i do *not* agree with how the PVE has been pulled back from what was promised, and how the microtransactions have been implemented.

if you're curious and interested in colourful online shooters, give it a try. the gameplay at its core is probably a bit on the "competitive" side of things for some players, but there's still a great time to be had even just casually. however, if you're against laughably-overpriced (albeit cosmetic) microtransactions, then this is absolutely not the title for you. the devs only make money if you choose to give it to them. ALL of the pvp content is accessible for free, so the "f2p" title is is not misleading.

there's room in this world for more than one team-based shooter featuring various playable characters (a concept that TF2 popularized, but did not invent). it'd be cool if people could stop acting like one has to beat the other; i play TF2 *and* Overwatch, happily. it's as cringe as fighting console wars in 2023. 5v5 role-queue feels nothing like 10v10 no class-limits, but you wouldn't know that unless you actually tried the game.
